metadata.title: CVE-2023-25731 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Due to URL previews in the network panel of developer tools improperlystoring URLs, query parameters could potentially be used to overwriteglobal objects in privileged code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <110.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
